messages.text:
Thanks for the lightning review.  Amazingly this feature of echo was
introduced quite late in MS-DOS's life - back in the day the only way
to make a newline was to echo the appropriate ANSI codes.

On 16 February 2012 20:31, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:
> LGTM
>
> whoa, really?  wow.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=ea655c80913b ***

make.bat, run.bat: echo newlines

R=golang-dev, rsc
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5671072

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

subject: code review 5671072: make.bat, run.bat: echo newlines
